Comment: People are just so reactionary like first of all the things that he's doing and that are happening are stuff that he said he would do and he's doing them   is he doing them with a lot of finesse? no but so what  Any one with the knowledge or nuanced understanding of any of these situations required to approach them with dexterity wouldn't do anything to disturb the status quo in the first place because they're politically invested in this stuff  Education is a disaster especially higher education complete and total waste of money in all areas. Education is important but the bureaucracy behind it is not making it better. Between Common Core, the way teachers are like disempowered from interacting with students, kind of parenting them, administrators being useless bureaucrats with humongous salaries for no reason, and then in higher education research on b******* topics, an avalanche of ascientific papers (we are STILL writing papers on string theory, tons and tons of papers on dark matter when none of them matter because at this point either detect that s*** or get out, etc) all the money that goes into things that literally cannot lead to someone getting a job other than in Dei offices, which even if we were still doing that there just are not enough job openings there and they're generally well-paid ( there's nothing wrong with learning about those types of topics but they shouldn't be publicly funded because the research is not research it's just opinion pieces sometimes written with an error of statistical rigor but by people who have no fundamental understanding of Statistics at all), etc.   Anyone who is smart enough to know which things to defund and how to restructure higher education and how to restructure the Department of Education in order to make them effective and efficient and useful to people is going to be too invested in the groups that would be negatively impacted by changes and so they would never implement changes because it would be political suicide. Trump has the luxury of not caring about that stuff.    So needed to happen this wasn't the best way but it needed to happen so who cares. And if you're thinking "I care" just remember that these institutions and strategies and policies were completely failing like increasingly worse.   Dei is demonstrably not effective. I'm going to guess that if there was like a relationship someone tried to draw between racial and gender animosity over time and the amount of money dumped into Dei it would be not the relationship that proponents would hope for. These departments are useless. They cause more problems than they solve it's just a bunch of moralizing busy bodies with God complexes and it's stupid.   Ukraine is a b******* situation as well. No one's ever going to put troops on the ground which is the only way they potentially win but they don't want to trigger World War 3. Without troops it's a losing battle like it could take longer if you give them more money but they will lose and Vlad has all the time and the money and the Manpower in the world. People are already talking about a demographic crisis in Ukraine like they just are not going to win ever so why are we throwing money at it when North Korea is really wanting to be a problem for everyone and China could still kind of be an issue at least briefly... I think it would take you know several hours probably to wipe out their military but it would cost several hundred billion dollars  And it quite simply is not the US's problem like why were we the ones funding it I don't get it. People need to be realistic and come to terms with the fact that even if morally it's wrong for Russia to basically Annex Ukraine they just are going to because nobody's going to do anything about it because it's not worth it. The type of war that would be fought between Russia and Europe is very different than the one that they're fighting against Ukraine Ukraine is an invasion if Russia was fighting NATO the weapons they would be choosing would be completely different way more destructive it's just going to be like a missile slugfest. Ukraine's not a buffer in that scenario.  The tariffs also I mean the rollout was comedically bad like really really bad but it was ultimately because China was already in a deflation spiral, xi xinping, after spending decades consolidating power is kind of losing his control over everything because of their economic situation, and the US is a huge huge huge percentage of their exports. So this is basically a way to put a foot on his neck, possibly suffocate the CCP of existence (it will still exist it will just not look anything, should xi be removed), and lowers the chances that Taiwan will be shelled. Because xi has propaganda as his population into thinking that China is like extremely prestigious in the world and it is getting his own citizens into trouble but definitely the illusion would be shattered if their entire Navy was obliterated and their economy sucks like he can't play victim in that case he just has to eat it  And illegal immigration and the perception that if you just get into the US eventually you'll be given amnesty (because it's basically true) is also something that kind of had to be dealt with and this is the definitely the worst way to do it but it was again the only way it was going to happen  And obviously the weird liberal defense of MS-13 was really disgusting and funny and like eventually they realized it was in defensible so they stopped talking about it but that's like one of the other reasons to just start deporting everyone because you just can't control something like that if you're just going to let everybody in.   I didn't vote for him, although he seems to overlap at least partially with the things that I think needed to be done. Again the implementation is not good and I don't like listen to anything that he says and I didn't watch The Campaign so I don't know like what the whole motivation is of doing it this way I'm guessing it's just ignorance but it was the only way it was going to happen it was this or nothing. they are like Necessary Things they were never going to be done by someone with the political Acumen and intelligence to do it right

Comment: We won't. The USA is going to collapse like the USSR did.   You can't have a Nation divided against itself. Countries and Nations and Governments aren't real things, they are ideas and beliefs. They are agreements.  The USA had its problems but after WW2 regardless of the differences we all agreed that we were Americans. That we would hang together or surely hang apart.   But various interests swarmed in after the Fairness Doctrine was revoked, and huge fortunes were given over to create the propaganda that held Party over Country, and sold the idea that not only did we not need to stick together, that in fact anyone not in your Party was not an American, they sold the image that the USA was best served by being divided against itself.  They painted a picture of how simple it could all be if, instead of debating and cooperating, what if we instead chose dehumanizing, and the use of force?   Now the ideas and the beliefs have all changed, and there is no room to even consider agreements.  The USA has already taken a mortal wound, and one that (despite any amount of outside influence) was largely self inflicted.  It just remains to be seen how long it will thrash around until it finally stops moving.

Comment: He won by telling the right lies to the right people at the right times. He called Hispanics and immigrants murderers and rapists behind their backs; but when he got in front of them, he promised them jobs, tax cuts, religious conservatism, improved immigration policies, and other things they wanted to hear. It's disgusting. American voters should be ashamed.

Comment: Republicans have always benefited from their voters skepticism that they would actually do the most stupid parts of their policies. I'd have to go digging but there's a study showing, even though the Republicans routinely say they would dismantle social security, none of their voters believe they would do it because it would be incredibly stupid.¬† You can see this effect with Trump.¬† They always tell themselves, "he wouldn't actually do that" because his lack of seeious talk is a perverse sign of authenticity.¬† I.e., He's unrehearsed and off the cuff.¬† Of course, there's a reason people rehearse their message and there's a reason that the president of the United States shouldn't be saying things off the cuff.¬†¬†   But don't tell me, I voted for this and I got them because I didn't.¬† Furthermore, if our electoral system weren't so screwed up I don't think we would have gotten him.¬† ¬†Yes this time he won the popular vote but if California voted like a swing state +10-12% turnout, he wouldn't have. The fact of the matter is our media ecosystem and winner-take-all electoral system, screws everything.¬† That doesn't mean those voters shouldn't bear responsibility.¬† He's obviously a hack and a fraud.¬† But I don't think people outside the Fox bubble realize it's pervasiveness. Comment: History is not on your side in terms of the accuracy of this argument. But it's interesting that you see it this way as a South Carolinan, because your state is one that has always had a volatile mix of ideologies. Things would look much worse from where you sit than from the rest of the country.   We survived the Civil War that literally cut us in half. We survived the Civil Rights movement which was as/more polarizing as any of this current shit. We survived  McCarthyism and the Red Scare which turned neighbors against neighbors and left society broken and hundreds of thousands of lives ruined. *(Interestingly, Senator McCarthy's right hand man was Roy Cohn, who then went on to mentor Trump. There's no doubt in my mind that Trump's ideas about America are largely driven by Cohn.)*  At every one of those points, we were a country totally divided in ideology, convinced the other side was evil incarnate and actively trying to destroy the country. The geographic boundaries that roughly mirrored the ideological ones were the same then as they are now.
Author: MommyLovesPot8toes

Comment: This has me pondering a fictitious world where, like the USSR, the states form their own confederacies. California, Oregon, Washington join along the coast. Texas making its own country again while maybe adopting Oklahoma and New Mexico. Florida with Alabama, Mississippi, and maybe Georgia. New York grabbing much of New England with more rural New York joining Pennsylvania, Ohio, and West Virginia to form a more mining-focused economy. Montana, the Dakotas, and the like would seem poised to be aligned, but the economies there likely leave a lot to be desired. Maybe states like Michigan or Minnesota join Canada. There are so many unlikely scenarios that could happen, but there's the slightest thread of logic behind each one.  It took about 70 years to go from formation to collapse of the USSR. This neck of the woods could look very different 100 years from now barring a major refocusing of the nation.
Author: Kaptain202

Comment: *We survived the Civil War that literally cut us in half*  Interesting that you consider that to be an example of why we'll be okay.  You know that practically every male person between the ages of 13 and 70 in the South DIED in that conflict, right? You know the South with a few regional exceptions was literally BURNED TO THE GROUND.   That the entire Confederate Army that surrendered numbered less than 28,000 men, when close to 300,000 had been killed on the Confederate side, and more men than that on the side of the North but the North had roughly triple the population of free people PRIOR the conflict.  It's why every podunk good ol' boy in the South with their stupid "my ancestors fought in the war!" BS is just that.   Not unless they had a child BEFORE the war, because afterwards basically all the men were DEAD.   **Not trying to argue that ending slavery was not a justifiable reason to do that**, okay, but it was hardly *no big deal.*   If that that's your metric of things that are survivable, I would not hold that particular conflict up as one where we worked through it.   If you've ever watched "Gone With The Wind" which is a ridiculously romanticized and fairly gross depiction of one spoiled rich girl before, during and after the War, still it depicts her as a heroine because she learns to do things like (checks notes) desperately eat rotten food she's grubbed around in the ruins for and declares AS GOD IS MY WITNESS I WILL NEVER GO HUNGRY AGAIN.  Scarlet O'Hara is a fictional character but nearly everyone she knew dying, entire cities burning, and mass starvation were NOT fictional.  If we're going to have to go through something like that again I personally WOULD call that conflict an example more of collapse than otherwise.  Weirdly I feel like the deep South in general and SC/NC/GA in particular are indeed a weird mix of ideologies, and frankly to go out the door around here shit is pretty chill. I don't think we'll be fighting our neighbors and I don't think that people here are interested in getting conscripted into a MAGA army to root out "the Homegrowns" as someone in the White House likes to call people like me. We have all sorts around here.   We are actually less overtly racist than a lot of places because our neighbors **are** POC. They CONVICTED the men who chased [Ahrmaud Arbery](https://www.justice.gov/archives/opa/pr/federal-judge-sentences-three-men-convicted-racially-motivated-hate-crimes-connection-killing#:~:text=A%20federal%20judge%20in%20the,and%20other%20offenses%20in%20connection) down and murdered him for the horrific hate crime that it was, even though they had buddies in the local law enforcement. Nobody around here lionizes Dylan Roof or holds up his disgusting attack as anything except what it was. People will spit on the ground and refuse to mention his name.  There's worse places you could be when the food runs out.  Which is what I am concerned will happen when the rest of the world is tired of our bullshit and dumps the USD as the world reserve currency, effectively making our dollar worth close to zero overnight.  I mean I know 47's group of "Administrators" have no damn idea what they're doing, but that doesn't mean the rest of the world is forced to play along.  The USD has been the world reserve currency because it was considered to be stable.  I can't see how anyone could argue that's true, going forward from here.
Author: maeryclarity

Comment: *Florida with Alabama, Mississippi, and maybe Georgia*  In your fictional world you should know that no one wants anything to do with Florida or Alabama. Idk about Mississippi, that's like another world from the networks of doing/business/social connections that are represented what I think of as the South,  Nah it would be Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina making its own little territory. Probably call it Georgialina 'cause we already refer to it thatway lol.   We have serious ties and we're not exactly the same place already but we're very interdependent.       We have deep water ports, the ability to generate a lot of electricity and the know how to keep it going since we get trashed by a Hurricane every goddamn year and have to put it back, we do a LOT of farming which is a mutually co-dependent economic activity (different than the way Big Ag does their thing, although we have the best Agricultural research and education in the Nation in one of those three places)...NC has a whole huge region dedicated to advanced research in all sorts of high level things (The Research Triangle)...      I mean I'm not saying like, that we're talking about it or anything \**cough cough* but let's just say that no one here believes it's unthinkable that things could be fixin' to get real weird, real quick.  *And if it does Miss Lindsey and MTG and Nancy Mace best stay their asses up in DC since that's who they seem to work for now and won't answer anyone's damn phone calls.*   Don't be trying to come running home *later.*

Comment: *\*shrugs*  My comment was made in the context of what the world is thinking about the USA/our relationship to the rest of the world, and our chances of "recovery" which will be heavily influenced by that.  We haven't yet started to really feel the damage this "Administration" has already done, nor the damage it will continue to do.  My pretty-much-mind-made-up bet as to the point is that where the REAL fun starts will be when the rest of the world rug pulls the use of the USD as the world reserve currency.  After all, its value for that purpose over the last roughly 80 years has been our *stability*.   It's the Secret Sauce that has made the USA such an economic power house.    You replace the USD with a basket of BRICS currencies and/or the Euro, then combine that with everything that's already happening, you have a pretty solid recipe for a level of economic disaster that could make the Great Depression look like a child's birthday party.   I don't want or wish for terrible things to happen. I'm not selling doom.   But I have been watching the USA truly devolve into a fascist Police State for my entire adult life, starting with Reagan, continued under every single  Administration since then, REALLY ramped up post 9/11, then yet again to even more next level shit post J6th. And now we have **this**.      We now have clearly demonstrated that our "stability" is a joke, that we are entirely at the mercy of the whims of whoever has the most money, we have a literal Clown Car Administration and there's no one at the wheel that is steering this situation ANYWHERE except off a cliff.  So the rest of the world should do business with us why? They should continue to listen to us and deal with us why? We are prepared to pull together and face an unprecedented economic disaster that's an entirely self-inflicted wound how?  I mean China is doing pretty great for themselves these days but between 1958 to 1962 so *four years* an unknown number but roughly 30 million people **starved to death.**   We've survived worse **so far.**   Truly, I do hope I'm catastrophizing. I have a large family and a lot of friends, grandchildren, I want it to work out after some turmoil that can be corrected.  But unfortunately, I don't believe I'm wrong.
Author: maeryclarity

If you are, you are fucked or about to be very fucked.

Comment: I agree with all of this but just want to point out a couple of things as a) someone who got into Civil War history as a kid, b) someone who has ancestors on both the U.S./union and confederate sides, c) someone who has had 3 generations of family obsessed with that book and film and had me reading/watching both from young childhood, and d) someone who has taught literature and film at the university level.   Your civil war numbers are correct but I suspect the people with whom you speak are either referencing indirect ancestors, or their ancestors were deserters, as all of my direct Southern ancestors were. Tons of men from that side deserted the war, usually because the conditions were so miserable and/or they worried their families were starving.   The reason that Scarlett‚Äîwho is a complex character in some ways‚Äîis hailed as a heroic figure (and I‚Äôm not necessarily saying I agree with that) isn‚Äôt because she ate rotten food but because of the actions she took after that to save herself and her family from starvation and financial ruin (mainly because she wanted to save the home in which she grew up). These actions included shooting a soldier who came into the house to loot it, being inventive when devising a plan to get money to pay the real estate tax bill, putting aside her disgust to marry a man who could financially help her family, and being such a successful businesswoman in that era that she becomes well-off again and is able to support her entire family. She‚Äôs a steely and daring person.   Now, she‚Äôs also unquestionably horrible, and the way she accomplishes these things deeply challenges the saying, ‚ÄúThe ends justify the means,‚Äù but that‚Äôs why (some) people admire her.
Author: LadyChatterteeth

Comment: My personal opinion of Trump: I am an American who has been aware of this man since the 1980s.  Donnie was featured on a show in the states called 'Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous' where they toured his home.  Everything was pseudo-opulent; I remember him even having a gold-plated toilet.   I was young when I saw this interview, but that day I finally understood the meaning of the term posh twat.  His first wife, Ivana,  was from Czechoslovakia.  While her native country  was not formally a part of the Soviet Union, it was a satellite state of the USSR. Trump was probably introduced to Russia via his wife, and he found the oligarch lifestyle over there most attractive.  I believe becoming a Russian oligarch was one of the goals in his life.  Everything he does is laced with one-upmanship. When you combine that with sociopathy and dementia, you have a perfect storm of failure, depraved indifference and disarray.  I recommend reading 'Too Much and Never Enough: How My Family Created the World's Most Dangerous Man' written by his niece Mary L. Trump who a doctorate in clinical psychology.  The book explains how Donald's psyche was created.
Author: Keefan

Comment: Ah, but that assumes these people would GO on that vacation. It's not necessarily a lack of funds - though that's a hurdle. It's a lack of intellectual curiosity and an outright fear of things outside their bubble.   Rural(ish) Americans are a fascinating study in base human emotions and instincts. They are no different than similar rural populations in other countries. But our space and low population density allows these communities to exist without exposure to people not like them. Meanwhile, the cities around them are heavily multicultural, in a country that doesnt require or expect assimilation.   Imagine leaving your 6,000 person rural town  - where not only is everyone white, but they all look alike from inbreeding - and driving a few hours to the nearest city for some appointment. In the city, you see signs and business names in 20 different languages.  Everyone else in the city looks perfectly comfortable in this environment, finding a way to communicate with one another despite accents you can't understand and words you've never heard. But YOU can't. You don't have the practice. You feel lost and left behind in *your own state*. It's disconcerting and scary and embarrassing. So as quickly as you can you escape back to what you know.  You're now reluctant to even go 3 hours to your nearest city if you don't absolutely HAVE to. Why on earth would you deliberately choose to go to another country where you'll feel *even more* lost and embarrassed? If you want international experiences, you'll drive into Kansas City and have dinner at the exotic Mexican restaurant.
Author: MommyLovesPot8toes

Trump Tower was one of a handful of actual development projects built by Trump after the pivot to luxury.  Iirc, most of the later projects with the Trump name on them were just branding deals.
